result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob G Craver was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Non-Narcotics, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program
77 days credit granted
Concurrent with: Any current sentence and Case 22CF1207

superMiscConds.notes:
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 

If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment. 

**Any prison gift funds are exempt from financial obligations**

AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended

Absolute sobriety, random UA's

No use or possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia

No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription

Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed

Inform agent of all prescriptions

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by agent

No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed

Mental health evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate

records.addlTxt: Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 10/06/2022 Plea and Sentencing Hearing in front of Judge Carter, filed by Court Reporter Cheryl Humpal

Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.  

Defense is ready to proceed with plea/sentencing. State files amended information. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to sole count of amended information. Court conducts colloquy and finds the Defendant guilty of sole count of amended information. 

State makes sentencing arguments. Defense makes sentencing arguments Defendant makes statements. 

Court orders the following: 

Total Prison: 30 months
Initial Confinement: 18 months
Extended Supervision: 12 months
77 Days Credit.
Concurrent to: any current sentence and 22CF1207

Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety; Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling in conjunction with treatment 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.. 
Mental Heath evaluation and treatment deemed appropriate.

COSTS:  $268.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $250.00
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of the Sentence. **ANY PRISON GIFT FUNDS ARE EXEMPT FROM FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS**

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Appeal rights given.

3:15 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense states that cases will be resolved, but has been unable to speak to charging DA re: offer that was extended. Defense requests to leave jury status and jury trial dates as set. 

Court leaves jury status and jury trial dates as set.
Hearing on October 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Hearing on October 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

10:08 AM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody.  Attorney Eryn M Menden in court for Jacob G Craver. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Abigail Kincheloe. Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office. 

Defense would like to resolve, but is awaiting a consolidated offer on all cases. 
State confirms there is no global offer at this time. 
Defense believes they are in receipt of all paper discovery, but is unsure re: electronic discovery. 
Defense states that the Defendant was revoked and will be going to Dodge Correctional. 

SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND MADE ON 22CF1207.
Hearing on September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

10:25 AM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.   Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  State provides discovery to defense in court.  Defense has received discovery.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for September 7, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 4, the Honorable Lloyd V. Carter, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Attorney Eryn Menden has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.
Status conference on August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:57 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with attorney Eryn M Menden.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 10:15 am.  Status conference scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Hearing on July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.

ADDRESS INFO for Jacob G Craver
Current: 515 W. Moreland Blvd., c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188   (Effective: 07-22-2022)
Prior: Homeless, Waukesha, WI 53186

02:21 PM Defendant Jacob G Craver in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern Erik Schlueter.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern Abigail Kincheloe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  The Court will set this matter back for status of counsel.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
